thread.title: New Google buys back shares

title: New Google buys back shares
text:
New Google buys back shares 
IOL Friday 23rd October, 2015 
San Francisco - Alphabet, the new holding company for Google, introduced its first share buyback and beat Wall Street's profit forecast on Thursday, helped by solid progress in mobile and video advertising, sending the stock to its highest-ever level in after-hours trading. 
Revenue and profit well above analysts' average forecasts, along with the unexpected buyback, was welcomed by Wall Street, which is now betting on further growth. 
"They're in a great position in the overall advertising space, whether it's search, display or mobile," said Kerry Rice, a Needham & Co analyst. "They'v...
